Breadth-First.Explanation: Broadly collecting visual clues (street sign, traffic lights, architecture) without a specific location hypothesis
Describing general street layout and features of Quintinsstraße and considering map lookup for context

Depth-First.Explanation: Verifying the hypothesis that it’s Mainz by matching postal code, building style, viaduct
Depth-First.KeyElement: Hypothesis: Mainz location; Clues: postal code 55116, historic white/red building, rail viaduct

Depth-First.Explanation: Focusing on the Rheingoldhalle area by analyzing bus shelter, signs, garages
Depth-First.KeyElement: Hypothesis: Rheingoldhalle vicinity; Clues: bus shelter orange stripe, green H stop sign, ramp entrance

Depth-First.Explanation: Testing the street-name origin hypothesis via nearby Church of St. Quintin
Depth-First.KeyElement: Hypothesis: Quintinsstraße named for St. Quintin; Clue: presence of St Quintin’s Church

Depth-First.Explanation: Deeply confirming the exact spot with multiple online references and signage details
Depth-First.KeyElement: Hypothesis: eastern end of Quintinsstraße by St Quintin’s Church; Clues: unique street name lookup, masonry match, viaduct alignment, MVG stop signage

Depth-First.Explanation: Confirming the final precise location hypothesis

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: After gathering broad clues, a specific Mainz hypothesis is formed and verification begins
Having confirmed Mainz, the analysis returns to general street layout exploration
Moving from broad street description to focused verification of the Rheingoldhalle area
